TITLE Butternut Squash Curry

# Preheat the oven to 400F.
# Peel and cut [4 cup butternut squash].
# Transfer to a baking tray or baking dish, drizzle some olive oil and salt and bake for about 30 minutes until colored and tender.
# While the squash is roasting, roughly chop [3 item shallot], [1 cloves garlic], [2 tbl ginger], [1 item carrot].
# In a medium pan add [1 tbl coconut oil] and fry the chopped vegetables. Saute until the shallots soften and the rest start to golden.
# In a blender combine half of the squash, all of the sauted vegetables, [125 g chickpeas], [1 tbl soy sauce], [300 ml vegetable broth], and [400 ml coconut milk]. Blend until smooth.
# Heat some [coconut oil] in a pan and add [1 tbl red curry paste]. Saute gentle to bloom the curry.
# Add the blended mixture, [125 g chickpeas], and the other half of the roasted butternut squash still in cubes.
# Simmer for 10 minutes, add [Lime juice] and [salt] to taste.
